text: The bedroom is small and brightly-colored. stars and movie stars and pretty photos on bed with a massive pink down comforter and beneath it. backdrop hung on sits in the dark. Posters of pop the wall. A twin something tiny  A BUBBLY ELECTRO-POP SONG fades up. Just as the song starts to get loud, just as the song sta to reveal itself as the perfect accompaniment for a sprin morning, the pink comforter on the bed stirs and a tiny h emerges, turning off the song that’s blaring from an iPho plugged in on the bedside table. Kayla emerges from the bed in her pajamas. She gets up an stretches, making weird morning sounds in the quiet room. INT. KAYLA’S BATHROOM —- MOMENTS LATER

-- Post-it notes lining the border of a large bathroom mirror. Reminders and lyrics and quotes: “TRUST YOURSELF. “DON’T JUST FLY, SOAR.” “BE YOUR OWN KIND OF BEAUTIUFL.” NEW TOOTHBRUSH.” Some look freshly made, others old, thei bright colors fading. -- The bathroom is filled with steam. Kayla appears in fr of the mirror freshly showered, one towel wrapped around body, another wrapping her hair. -- Kayla gets close to the mirror, rubs moisturizer on he face, takes the towel of her head. -- Kayla blow dries her hair. -- Kayla opens her LAPTOP on the bathroom counter. Opens browser. Goes to her BOOKMARKS tab and scrolls down to a YouTube link titled: MY EVERYDAY CASUAL MAKEUP TUTORIAL. -- Kayla applies foundation, glancing back and forth from own reflection to her laptop’s screen. -- ON KAYLA’S LAPTOP - a beautiful, well-lit YOUNG WOMAN sits in her bedroom, applying foundation in close-up. The video has seven million views. -- Kayla applies some subtle eyeliner. Consults the mirro the laptop, the mirror again, Blush. Lip gloss. Kayla. He reflection. The Young Woman on the screen. All getting re together. -- Kayla inspects her finished hair and makeup from multi angles. -- Kayla grabs her laptop and pajamas off the bathroom counter and exits.

-- Kayla has changed back into her pajamas and is now climbing back into bed. -- Kayla gets under the covers, careful not to mess up he hair. She puts her head on the pillow, lifts her iPhone a takes a selfie, straining to seem casual. -- Another selfie on the bed from a different angle. -- Another. And Another. And another. -- Kayla sits on the edge of her bed, still in her pajama She looks at her phone. -- ON KAYLA’S PHONE SCREEN: Kayla is on Instagram, postin the selfie of her “waking up.” She chooses a filter. She captions the photo: “just woke up. ughhhhh” She posts it. ELECTRONIC MUSIC. LOUD. BRIGHT. MACRO SHOTS: a grid of a thousand pixels, forming picture text, moving images, then closer, to the stark reality of Liquid Crystal Display: dozens of rectangular blocks of light, the SUBPIXELS, in repeating groups of three, red/blue/green, arranged in rows and columns, so close no that no image can form, no colors even beyond the three present, flashing and pulsing with abstract order: Redbluegreenblueredgreenblueredbluegreenredbluegreenbluer

Kayla, now dressed for school, walks down the sidewalk. H massive backpack forces her to lean forward, hands clutch the shoulder straps. She has headphones in. We follow her close, at eye-level. The world is big. She is small and moving quickly through
Kayla walks, headphones blaring. The sun is shining. She doesn’t notice. A car passes and someone inside screams a Kayla as it whizzes by.  Kayla doesn’t notice.

Kayla keeps walking. Stops. Takes out her iPhone and look at it. ON THE SCREEN: her Instagram photo has received zero like and one comment. The comment, from asherk1313, reads: “ew Kayla stares at the phone and deletes her photo. She look and hustles across the street. Pan to reveal, MILES GROVE MIDDLE SCHOOL, a giant brick building, wide and sturdy, beyond a large parking lot. Kayla walks toward it, getting smaller and eventually disappearing into the mass of kids and cars and buses tha are all being pulled inward toward the school. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) Your body is changing.

Kayla walks down the crowded hallway, backpack on. Rather than the sounds of the busy hallway, we hear a calm adult female voice and the cheesy educational score accompanyin her. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) This change can be scary. But this change is a good thing. It means that you are becoming an adult. Kayla walks, moving forward, head down. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) You may have noticed hair starting to grow in new places.
Kayla sits on the toilet in a stall. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) You may have noticed hair starting to grow in new places. Kayla reaches for toilet paper.

THREE GIRLS (13) stand in front of the three available mirrors, preening themselves. Kayla stands behind them, h hands out awkwardly, waiting to wash them. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) You may have begun to gain some weight or grow taller....This is normal...This is healthy. Kayla waits, hands out. The three girls don’t notice her. INT. ART CLASS. LATER. Kayla sits at a long, dirtied table in the back of the ar class, working on something with her hands: It’s some weird clay thing. Like a sculpture/face/mug, gr and soft and shiny and wet and Kayla is molding it with h hands, putting the finishing touches onto something that turning around nothing like she hoped it would. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) Your body...is an amazing thing. A BANGING sound. Kayla looks over to see a large BOY (13) sitting beside her, punching his clay into the table with both hands.

Kayla waits at the water fountain, behind a GIRL (13) who drinking at it. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) And your body deserves respect. By understanding exactly how your body is changing, you are respecting your body and yourself. The girl finally stops drinking, then immediately reaches into her backpack, takes out an empty water bottle and be filling it at the fountain. Kayla waits.

The room is dark and a TV has been wheeled out in front o the students. We see THE WOMAN (40s) who has been speakin the screen - looking directly into camera. Behind the TV, MRS. NOLAN (50s) works behind her desk.  7. The students watch the movie with a mixture of awe, confu and disgust. In the back, Kayla cranes her neck to see.

Over the course of these next thirty minutes, we will begin to explore and understand these changing bodies of yours. Kayla gives up trying to see. She looks around, bored - s something. ACROSS THE ROOM - a STRANGE BOY has his head tucked in hi shirt, the glow of his phone illuminating from inside the fabric: he’s secretly watching a video. And doing something else. Kayla stares. Confused. WOMAN ON THE TV (CONT’D) Chapter One: The Hair Down There. GIRL’S VOICE (0.S.)
A silence. Then the class FREAKS OUT. Laughs and screams “ewww"s. Mrs. Nolan tries to calm them down.

Hey! Quiet! QUI-ET! It’s no use. It’s chaos. Boys point and laugh. Girls scre and heckle in disgust. Tristan denies everything. Mrs. No fails to control the situation. And way in the back, Kayla sits quietly. As commotion in the classroom builds and crescendos, we h something else, an orchestra, swelling and overtaking the noise of the kids as we cut to--

Kayla walks down the hallway. We hear only the orchestra, straining to play correctly, bum notes everywhere, sectio off tempo, instruments out of tune, the whole piece dragg and plodding along, a ton of effort, little success. Kayla walks down the hallway. The orchestra strains to sc the moment.  INT. AUDITORIUM. DAY. The stage of the auditorium, and the source of the sound we've been hearing: a fifty-piece student orchestra is mi performance, the MUSIC TEACHER standing in front of them, conducting. We drift through the students, trumpet players with red faces, violinists with poor posture, clarinet players wit split reeds squeaking out a high harmony. It’s a mess. We arrive at the back, where Kayla is stationed, one gian CYMBAL in each hand, waiting for her moment. The song ends and she smacks them together a fraction lat CRASSSSHHHHHHH. A pause. Then light applause.
Kayla sits in the audience with her classmates.
Thank you again to the school band for that wonderful performance. Impressive stuff. PRINCIPAL MCDANIEL (40s, gentle) is standing on stage.
..-Alright, eighth graders! Next week is your last week here at Miles Grove Middle School. Huge cheer.

Okay, okay, yep, very good -- but, BUT...we still have a lot of important work ahead of us. And a lot of FUN work ahead of us. We have the High School Shadow Program early next week...We also have a few guest speakers. Should be fun. And the end of the year dance. Whoops and cheers from the crowd.

And, AND...we have your sixth grade Time Capsules for you to pick up today. Remember those shoeboxes that you made during the first week of sixth grade? Remember how we said that those Time Capsules were going to be a gift for the future “you” that would eventually “make it” here at Miles Grove Middle School? Well, YOU have MADE IT. So pick those up in the lobby when this assembly is over...Alright, now I’m going to turn things over to Mrs. Roach who will read the results of the eighth grade class superlatives! Hushed excited reaction from the crowd. Whispers, “yessss
Mrs. Roche? MRS. ROCHE (50s, stone-faced) walks onto the court. She stands behind a podium and reads.
If your name is called, please report to the Band Practice Room after this Assembly to have your picture taken for the yearbook.
But pick up your Time Capsules first!
Yes...okay...Class Superlatives, as voted by you - the students. Each category has a male and female winner from the student body. Okay...Most Athletic... Danny Atchison and Olivia Elder...
Woo! Yeah Oliviaaaa!

Most artistic...Wyatt Conville and Dawn Ringelheim... Kayla sits in the crowd, picking at her nails.  10. MRS. ROCHE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Class Clowns...Jed Goodwin and Missy Vitale... Somewhere in the crowd, Jed makes a loud FART NOISE and t auditorium laughs. Classic Jed. Kayla continues to pick a her nails. Bites them. Bored, not nervous. We stay on her MRS. ROCHE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Most Talkative...Pat Druschel and Jackie Stasiak....Most Quiet... This gets Kayla’s attention. She stops fidgeting. Closes eyes. MRS. ROCHE (0.S.) (CONT’D) ...Andrew Fields and Kayla Day. Kayla grimaces. Balls her hands into fists. Shrinks.
Best eyes...

The eighteen superlative winners sit in the Band Room amo the music stands and instruments. Kayla sits by herself. She looks over at a GROUP OF GIRLS who are inspecting and sharing at each other’s Time Capsules -- bright shoeboxes full of personal trinkets. The girls laugh and do a lot o “OH my god”s and “shut UP”s. Kayla looks down at her Time Capsule sitting on her lap - the outside made purple and pink with construction paper. the top of the shoebox’s lid, in large glittery pink lettering, sixth-grade Kayla wrote:

head_text.subj: TO THE COOLEST GIRL IN THE WORLD

text: Kayla stares at this. A door opens. Mr. M enters.

Okay superlative winners, so after you've taken your picture please return to your fifth period classes. Okay, we will start with...Mr. and Mrs. Best Eyes! Aiden Wilson-Carter and Kennedy Graves!  11. The group of girls cheer as one of them stands. This is KENNEDY GRAVES (13, "cool"). She walks past Kayla.
(weak thumbs up) Good job. Kennedy passes her, doesn’t hear and/or care.

Aiden...AIDEN! TIME SLOWS and MUSIC BLASTS as AIDEN WILSON-CARTER (13, perfect) looks up from his phone in the back of the room. face is blank and bored. His eyes are the best. He gets up and walks toward the front of the room, in slo motion, annoyed and bored. Kayla turns and looks at him, face deflating into awe - he somehow gets hotter every ti she sees him. He passes her and the music stops abruptly and we snap ba into real time just in time to hear a faint, breathy:
Good j-.... Aiden arrives at the front of the room.
Hey, Aiden.
Hey.
(fishing) So embarrassing that we got voted best eyes, like honestly like I don’t even think my eyes are that great.
(almost a robot) Yeah... Kennedy and Aiden follow Mr. McDaniel out of the room. Ka watches them leave and then looks down at the time capsul her lap.  12.

head_text.subj: TO THE COOLEST GIRL IN THE WORLD

text: Kayla gently lifts the lid off of the shoebox. She begins removing and inspecting things. A movie ticket stub. A sm frog figurine. A Justin Bieber magnet. Then, a picture of a young Kayla on a field trip with her class. She’s smiling in this picture. Surrounded by her classmates. She’s about to close the capsule, when she spots somethin TINY PLASTIC SPONGEBOB SQUAREPANTS. She picks it up with fingers and stares at it. The plastic Spongebob stares back as we hear a door open.

(whispering) Shhhh..-.hey....hey....I’m looking for Mr. and Mrs. Most Quiet, Andrew Fields and Kayla Day. Shhhh.... Kayla looks up. :-| INT. MUSIC CLASSROOM. MOMENTS LATER. A PHOTOGRAPHER (50s, tired) sits on a stool behind a came and tripod. Mr. McDaniel enters the room, trailed by Kayl and ANDREW FIELDS (13, silent, very weird).

Alright guys, just pop a squat over there and we’ll get a few glamour shots. Kayla and Andrew walk over to the “photo shoot area” -- t adjacent chairs set up in front of a hung backdrop, flank by mounted lights and reflecting umbrellas. They sit.

So we've been trying to do sort of funny poses that reflect the superlatives. Like for the Most Athletic, Danny pretended to be running for a touchdown and Olivia pretended to be tackling him. So, it should be fun, you know? You guys have any ideas? No response, obviously.  13.
Oh! Maybe Andrew, you could be holding a book, and Kayla, maybe you could be shushing him like you're at a library or something?
Battery’s dead. Gotta run to my car.

Oh, okay. No problem...You know what, I think I’1l run to the restroom. Hang tight kids! The Photographer and Mr. McDaniel exit. Kayla and Andrew together, alone, side-by-side. Kayla fidgets with her nails, busy. Andrew stares straigh ahead, slack-jawed, teeth in braces, ostensibly brain-dea They are quiet from two totally different places -- self- consciousness and unconsciousness. They sit in silence for a FULL MINUTE. Sixty excruciating seconds. No one enters.
Kayla exits the school, wearing her backpack. An SUV pull and honks. Kennedy Graves (Miss Best Eyes) climbs into th passenger seat. DIANNE GRAVES (40s) shouts past her daugh to Kayla.
Hey! Little one! She honks. Kayla notices, walks over, hesitantly. Kennedy rolls her eyes. DIANNE GRAVES (CONT’D) (to Kayla) You're Mark’s girl, right?
Yeah. Kennedy, stuck in the middle of this, glares at Kayla.
Your dad was such a huge help with the spring fundraiser. Thank him again for me, will you?  Blue 14.
I will.
What’s your name again?
(annoyed) Kayla.

Kayla! Yes! Kayla, you know, we just opened our pool... Kennedy turns to her, widens her eyes. DIANNE GRAVES (CONT’D) (to Kennedy) Shush. (to Kayla) We just opened our pool and we’re having our first big pool party of the summer for Kennedy’s birthday tomorrow. You should come. Gonna be lots of fun, right Kennedy?
Yep.
You should come. It’s gonna be a blast. Kennedy will send you an invite on facebook. Right Kennedy?
Ohmygod.
Can you make it? Kayla looks at Kennedy, sees how unwanted she is.
Maybe...I probably can’t. I’1l try but I probably can’t.
Try to make it. You’1l have a blast. And say thanks to your dad again for me.  15.
Okay.
Great! See you tomorrow maybe!
Okay maybe, probably not though, thank you.
Say bye, Kennedy.
Bye.
Bye. They drive away. Kayla stands in place, staring straight ahead, perfectly still. Then, suddenly, she RUNS. We follow her, close, as she sprints across the parking lot, away from the school.

Kayla continues her sprint down the sidewalk, her backpac weighing her down, forcing her to run awkwardly in weird, forceful lunges. She breathes heavily, running as hard as can with the weight on her back. She sprints across the street, tiring but pushing through down a sidewalk, then another street, passing a woman wal her dog, a couple kids walking back from school, she runs past them, her arms swinging to counteract the backpack t wants to pull her down. She forces herself forward. Can’t anymore. She slows and collapses onto a patch of grass, backpack first, like a flipped turtle. She closes her eyes and catches her breath, nearly hyperventilating. As her breath returns, she slowly rocks to her side, lift herself to her feet, and continues in the same direction had just been running - now just walking, head down.  16. INT. DINING ROOM KAYLA’S HOUSE. NIGHT CLOSE ON on Kayla’s iPad. Her tiny finger opens her iTune app and selects a BRIGHT CHEERY POP SONG. It plays loudly Her tiny finger touches the screen, minimizing iTunes and opening her Instagram app. She scrolls through the feed people she follows: A video OF A BOY HER AGE BOWLING, captioned: “matty getti ready to suck 101111111”. A PICTURE OF THREE GIRLS HER AG PAINTING THEIR NAILS, captioned: “friday nite nail party #GETIT”. DEMI LOVATO backstage getting ready for a show. Kayla scrolls past dozens of photos - all showing various fun, eighth-grade Friday nights being had by her classmat A wide view reveals Kayla’s Friday night: a quiet dinner home with DAD. Homemade chicken breast and green beans on each of their plates. Two bowls of extras between them. Kayla scrolls through her iPhone with her headphones in, the iPad propp up on a stand in front of her plate of food. Dad eats quietly. Kayla doesn’t touch her plate, the soun of Kayla’s music now buzzing quietly in her ears.
...Kayla. She doesn’t hear him.
eeeee Kayla......Kay.... Dad waves his arms, flagging her down. Kayla removes one the earbuds from her left ear.
Food’s getting cold.
I like it cold.
Okay. She puts the earbud back in. Resumes scrolling.
One more week of eighth grade, huh?  17. Kayla removes her earbud, annoyed.
What??
I said one more week of eighth grade, right??
Yep.
Crazy...Can’t believe you’re gonna be in high school. You excited?
Yep.
You're getting a little taste of it next week, right? The high school shadow thing?
Yeah.
That’s fun. Do you know who you’re following around yet?
No. Kayla goes to put her earbud back in, Dad cuts her off:
Hey, I got an email from Mrs. Graves. Said you’re going to Kennedy's birthday thing tomorrow?
I’m not.
Really?
Yeah, no.
Sounded kinda fun.  18.
Kennedy doesn’t like me.
That can’t be true.
Cool.

You know sometimes kids act like they don’t like you but really that’s just cause they got their own stuff going on- Dad stops as he notices that Kayla has put her headphones back in and is staring at her iPhone, not listening to hi
rs Kayla?........Kayla......... He crumples up a napkin and tosses it across the table, hitting Kayla in the head. Kayla rips out her headphones.

head_text.subj: ARE YOU KIDDING ME RIGHT NOW

text: Dad laughs, Kayla doesn’t.
Hey, come on, I’m being funny.
If you’re the only one that thinks it’s funny it’s not funny it’s just annoying.
(crossing his eyes) Whaaaaaat?
STOPPP. It’s Friday night, you said I can do whatever I want on Fridays-
I know, I know and you can, sorry. Just let me say one thing and then you can do your iPhone and I’1l leave you alone, alright?? Kayla huffs, slams down her iPhone, glares at him.  19.
Fine. What.
Okay...But you gotta listen. Don’t be angry before I even say it or you won’t really hear it, okay?
OHMYGOD, Dad, just say it--
Alrightalrightokay -- I’m saying ite... Dad gathers himself. Pauses.
I’m THINKING. Kayla closes her eyes. So frustrated.
...I...I think you’re so cool-
(huge huff, so embarrassed) Dad, seriously, I’m gonna stop eating with you if--
You said I could say my one thing so let me say it...

I think you’re so cool. When I was your age, I wasn’t cool like you. You have all these interests and you make all your videos and stuff and that’s so great and cool. But...You know but sometimes I just worry that you don’t put yourself out there--
Please stop--  20.

I know, look, I know the kids at school aren’t great. I’m not saying you have to be best friends with Kennedy Graves, alright?...I just - and you're gonna think this is lame - but I just think you’re a really special person. Kayla buries her head in her hands.
(muffled through hands) UHMUHGUHH.

I do! Sorry, I do. You know, and I know dads are supposed to think their kid is special no matter what but I’m telling you Kayla, if I wasn’t your dad, I’d still think that. Sorry. I would. And, I just--
This is more than one thing.

It’s one chunk. I’m saying one chunk of stuff...And I know it’s like “shut up, dad” and I get it, I really do, I know I’m being lame but I’m not trying make you feel bad when I say this stuff, I’m actually trying make you feel better.
Then let me use my iPad. Dad sees that this isn’t going anywhere.
..+.sure, yeah, do your thing. Dad smiles, sad, as his daughter puts her headphones back and stares at her iPad. They sit in silence.
Hey, Kay, remember when I used to do Monkey Chicken Man? Kayla ignores him, doesn’t look up.  21. Blue

(doing a funny voice, weird arm gestures) I’m a Monkey Chicken Maaaan, I'ma Monkey Chicken Maaaan. Oo oo BOCK BOCK o00 oo BOCK BA-COCK! Dad laughs. Kayla stares at her iPad. Dad gives up, for n goes back to eating. They sit in silence. INT. KAYLA’S BEDROOM. LATER Kayla lies on her bed, earbuds in, buzzing quietly, her laptop open on her chest. She is BROWSING THE INTERNET. She stares at her computer screen, her face is in blank contrast to the things she’s looking at: MUSIC VIDEOS,

head_text.subj: ARTICLES, PICTURES, EVERYTHING, EVERY PIECE OF CULTURE EV
RIGHT HERE IN FRONT OF HER IN BRIGHT LIGHT.

text: Her phone buzzes. She shuts her laptop. On her phone’s homescreen, two notifications from Twitter ONE NEW FOLLOWER, ONE NEW DIRECT MESSAGE. She opens her Twitter app. In her notifications: KENNEDY GRAVES JUST FOLLOWED YOU. She goes into her direct messages. There’s a fresh messag from Kennedy: Hi, so my mom said to invite you to my thin tomorrow, so this is me doing that. Kayla stares at the ‘invitation.’ She clicks on Kennedy’s name and is brought to Kennedy’s twitter profile. She has cute profile picture. Her latest tweet was a tweet to @awcl23: hey mr best eyes wat u lookin at lmao. Kayla clicks on @awcl23 and is brought to AIDEN’S PROFILE His profile picture is a douchey photo of him looking swe after a lacrosse game. Kayla plugs in her headphones, goes to iTunes in her phon selects a pop song, and blasts it, scoring the following:  22. She returns to Aiden’s twitter page. Goes to the MEDIA section and scrolls through the photos and videos he’s posted, breathing heavily. A selfie. A pic after practice Then something stops her. A video Aiden has posted titled STRAIGHT FLEXIN BRUH. She clicks it. It’s an iPhone video Aiden took of himself. He’s wearing tank top and flexing his muscles in his bathroom mirror. Kayla watches it. She watches him. Her heart practically vibrating. She brings her hand up to her mouth and bites her nails. Aiden flexes, smiles. Kayla stops biting. Keeps her hand her mouth. As the song climaxes, Kayla turns her hand ove and kisses it. Aiden keeps flexing as Kayla begins to full-on make out w the back of her hand, eyes closed, like Aiden and her are kissing in the rain. The music follows suit. Then, A KNOCK ON HER DOOR. Kayla jumps, rips out her headphones, and THROWS her iPho across the room. It makes an awful sound.
I’m going to bed.
Alright, good night.
You mad at me?
Just don’t knock so loud.
Right. Yep. Sorry. Night.  23. We hear Dad leave as Kayla rolls over and off the bed. Sh walks across the room to her iPhone. It’s screen down on ground.

Pleasepleasepleaseplease. Kayla picks up the phone and turns it over: THE SCREEN IS CRACKED. Behind the violent web of jagged black lines, her homescr is a picture of Demi Lovato laughing. The time, 11:13 PM.

Sssssssshit. Shitshitshit. Kayla grunts and whines, so angry she could cry. She flop back onto her bed, lies down, stares at the ceiling. Ugh. Then, with sudden purpose, still mad, she sits up, rolls her bed, walks across the room and unzips her backpack. S takes out her TIME CAPSULE, puts it on the floor, rips of the top, fishes through the box, grabs something, and sto back to bed. She get under the covers and lays still. The room is dark She brings her hand up close to her face and we see what grabbed out of the box: The tiny plastic SPONGEBOB SQUAREPANTS. She stares. Spong stares back. She rips Spongebob from his Squarepants - it USB DRIVE. She grabs her laptop and opens it. HARSH LIGHT. She plugs Spongebob in to her laptop and minimizes her browser. The appears on the desktop as an icon “16GB FileSystem.” Kayla clicks it. The drive contains one video file. It’s titled “DEAR 8TH GRADE KAYLA.” Kayla puts her headphones in. Stares at her screen. Hesitates. Then clicks. We hear Kayla’s voice. It’s younger.
Hey, Kayla! It’s you, Kayla.  24. Young Kayla laughs. We stay on our Kayla, never seeing wh playing on the screen.
I’m just making this video to congratulate you on finishing 8th Grade! Woohooo! I am so, so, so, so, SOOOOO proud of you. Kayla watches, squinting, uncomfortable.

I'm making this video on a FRIDAY. I just finished my first week of sixth grade and I’m about to have my first middle school weekend so that’s pretty cool - you’ve had a bunch of middle school weekends so they’re probably not cool to you anymore. Kayla cringes at herself. Keeps watching. YOUNG KAYLA (CONT’D) I have so many questions for you. Are you still doing karate? I’ma yellow belt now, what belt are you? Do you have a boyfriend? Is he nice? What’s the COOLEST thing you've done? What’s the SECOND coolest? You don’t have to answer because I can’t hear you obviously but anyway, yeah, I’m really excited for middle school and, um, like, I just wanted to make this video to say great job and you’re the best and I hope you had a lot of fun in middle school and I hope all your new friends are being nice to you because you deserve it. Okay. Stay cool! I can’t wait to be you. Byeeeee. The sound stops. Kayla stares. ON THE SCREEN: we get our only glimpse at the sixth-grade Kayla, frozen in her seat, giving a smile and a wave to t camera. Her face is smaller. Rounder. Kayla Xs out of the video. Closes her laptop. Opens her p Aiden’s video is still up behind the cracked glass. Kayla out of it. She clicks on her direct messages. The message from Kenne  25. Kayla thinks. EXT. KENNEDY’S HOUSE. THE NEXT DAY. Low angle on a colossal MCMANSION. Green lawn that looks fake. Stone walkway. It’s all just big and gross and scar Dad's pickup truck is parked in front of it. Kayla sits shotgun, staring out the window away from Dad who stares her from the driver’s seat. Kayla doesn’t move. A long silence.
I’m so glad you're doing this. This’ll be good. I think you’re gonna have a lot of fun.
Mmm. Kayla keeps staring at the house, tense. Doesn’t move.
Want me to walk you in?
No. Kayla keeps staring. Dad sits patiently. Kayla takes a de breath and exits the car, holding a backpack and a small wrapped gift.
Text me when you want to get picked up.

Okay. Kayla shuts the door and walks towards the front door. Th sounds of splashing and screaming in the backyard. The so are strange and abstract and unsettling. They get louder as she gets closer to the house. Kayla arrives at the front door and rings the doorbell. S turns and sees Dad still parked on the street. She shoos annoyed. He waves back and drives away. The door opens. Dianne Graves stands in the doorway, smil a bit too wide.  26.
Kayylaaaa!
Hi, Mrs. Graves.
Oh please, call me Dianne.
Okay.
Where’s your father?
He drove away.
Mmm bummer. Everyone’s out back by the pool. Did you bring a swimsuit?
Yeah, it’s in my bag.

Great! Come on inside and we'll get you changed. Dianne puts her hand on Kayla’s back and leads her inside closing the door behind them. The foyer of the house is huge. Kayla looks around. It’s largest house she’s ever been in.

You can put your gift right over there on the dining room table. Dianne turns Kayla towards the dining room and a table pi with wrapped birthday presents. Kayla adds her small gift to the huge mass, making no difference.
We'll open gifts after cake. Here, let's find you a bathroom to change in.
Okay.  27. Dianne leads Kayla out of the dining room and down a hall towards the back of the house. Dianne opens one of the ma closed doors in the hallway.
You can change in here. And then the kids are just out back through the sliding door just out there, okay, honey?
Okay. Thank you, Dianne.

No problem! Kayla walks into the BATHROOM and closes the door. The pa outside is closer and louder now. text: A bus-load of eighth graders parked outside MILES GROVE H The kids talk and laugh and goof around. Kayla sits again one of the windows toward the back of the bus. She is attentive, quiet, nervous, ready for something. Mr. McDaniel stands at the front of the bus, no one pays attention to him - except for Kayla, who sits up straight listens very carefully.

Settle down! Settle! Okay, you are all here as part of the High School Shadow Program...we’re going to all walk in as a group, then you will be individually paired with one of the students from Miles Grove High. (MORE )

MR. MCDANIEL (CONT’D) You will stay with that one person for the entire school day. You are not, I repeat, NOT to leave their side. These students volunteered and are here to help you and guide you through a day of high school. Some of you will be paired with freshmen, others will be paired with sophomores or juniors. So please be respectful and take it all in. This should be a learning experience. In the back, Kayla is listening, nodding. MR. MCDANIEL (0.S.) (CONT’D) This is your chance to get a glimpse of what life will be like for you next year. So pay attention. Kayla listens to this intensely, psyching herself up. MR. MCDANIEL (0.S.) (CONT’D) And have fun.

The hallway is crowded with high school kids. They are bigger. Older. They talk and move and load things in and of lockers. Then, from within the chaos, a LINE OF MIDDLE SCHOOLERS, moving slowly down the middle of the hallway, bisecting the crowd. The middle schoolers move in single file - and each middl schooler has his or her right arm attached to the right shoulder of the person in front of him or her. They march like prisoners through the gauntlet of the older kids. And somewhere in the line is Kayla, her eyes scanning everything around her.

Daddd.

rs okay......
